channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-29078] RuntimeException: Null when starting standalone HMS
item.description:
Build standalone HMS tar againt branch-4.1 (https://github.com/apache/hive/tree/branch-4.1)

cd hive/standalone-metastore
mvn clean install -DskipTests -Pdocker -Pdist

Get the binary tar standalone-metastore/packaging/target/hive-standalone-metastore-4.1.0-bin.tar.gz

Tried to start HMS, startup was successful, but found an error. Not sure this error has any other bad effect.

2025-07-09T15:13:05,134 ERROR [Metastore threads starter thread] leader.LeaseLeaderElection: Error notifying the listener: org.apache.hadoop.hive.metastore.leader.CompactorTasks@e0059c8, leader: true
java.lang.RuntimeException: null
        at org.apache.hadoop.hive.metastore.PersistenceManagerProvider.retry(PersistenceManagerProvider.java:662) ~[hive-standalone-metastore-server-4.1.0.jar:4.1.0]
        at org.apache.hadoop.hive.metastore.PersistenceManagerProvider.updatePmfProperties(PersistenceManagerProvider.java:270) ~[hive-standalone-metastore-server-4.1.0.jar:4.1.0]
        at org.apache.hadoop.hive.metastore.ObjectStore.setConf(ObjectStore.java:373) ~[hive-standalone-metastore-server-4.1.0.jar:4.1.0]
        at org.apache.hadoop.util.ReflectionUtils.setConf(ReflectionUtils.java:77) ~[hadoop-common-3.4.1.jar:?]
        at org.apache.hadoop.util.ReflectionUtils.newInstance(ReflectionUtils.java:159) ~[hadoop-common-3.4.1.jar:?]
        at org.apache.hadoop.util.ReflectionUtils.newInstance(ReflectionUtils.java:126) ~[hadoop-common-3.4.1.jar:?]
        at org.apache.hadoop.hive.metastore.RawStoreProxy.<init>(RawStoreProxy.java:59) ~[hive-standalone-metastore-server-4.1.0.jar:4.1.0]
        at org.apache.hadoop.hive.metastore.RawStoreProxy.getProxy(RawStoreProxy.java:67) ~[hive-standalone-metastore-server-4.1.0.jar:4.1.0]
        at org.apache.hadoop.hive.metastore.HMSHandler.newRawStoreForConf(HMSHandler.java:565) ~[hive-standalone-metastore-server-4.1.0.jar:4.1.0]
        at org.apache.hadoop.hive.metastore.HMSHandler.getMSForConf(HMSHandler.java:543) ~[hive-standalone-metastore-server-4.1.0.jar:4.1.0]
        at org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.txn.compactor.MetaStoreCompactorThread.init(MetaStoreCompactorThread.java:65) ~[hive-exec-4.1.0-core.jar:4.1.0]
        at org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.txn.compactor.Initiator.init(Initiator.java:232) ~[hive-exec-4.1.0-core.jar:4.1.0]
        at org.apache.hadoop.hive.metastore.leader.CompactorTasks.takeLeadership(CompactorTasks.java:140) ~[hive-standalone-metastore-server-4.1.0.jar:4.1.0]
        at org.apache.hadoop.hive.metastore.leader.LeaseLeaderElection.lambda$notifyListener$0(LeaseLeaderElection.java:141) ~[hive-standalone-metastore-server-4.1.0.jar:4.1.0]
        at java.base/java.util.ArrayList.forEach(ArrayList.java:1511) ~[?:?]
        at org.apache.hadoop.hive.metastore.leader.LeaseLeaderElection.notifyListener(LeaseLeaderElection.java:138) ~[hive-standalone-metastore-server-4.1.0.jar:4.1.0]
        at org.apache.hadoop.hive.metastore.leader.LeaseLeaderElection.doWork(LeaseLeaderElection.java:120) ~[hive-standalone-metastore-server-4.1.0.jar:4.1.0]
        at org.apache.hadoop.hive.metastore.leader.LeaseLeaderElection.tryBeLeader(LeaseLeaderElection.java:181) ~[hive-standalone-metastore-server-4.1.0.jar:4.1.0]
        at org.apache.hadoop.hive.metastore.leader.LeaseLeaderElection.tryBeLeader(LeaseLeaderElection.java:63) ~[hive-standalone-metastore-server-4.1.0.jar:4.1.0]
        at org.apache.hadoop.hive.metastore.leader.LeaderElectionContext.lambda$start$2(LeaderElectionContext.java:125) ~[hive-standalone-metastore-server-4.1.0.jar:4.1.0]
        at java.base/java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:833) [?:?]
        at org.apache.hadoop.hive.metastore.leader.LeaderElectionContext.start(LeaderElectionContext.java:136) [hive-standalone-metastore-server-4.1.0.jar:4.1.0]
        at org.apache.hadoop.hive.metastore.HiveMetaStore$8.run(HiveMetaStore.java:855) [hive-standalone-metastore-server-4.1.0.jar:4.1.0]
item.summary: RuntimeException: Null when starting standalone HMS

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Give some step to start standalone HMS:

  • Set env 
    #set HADOOP_HOME env
export HADOOP_HOME=/data01/data/hadoop

#create hms log directory
mkdir /data01/data/apache-hive-metastore-4.1.0-bin/log

#set log propertity
export HADOOP_CLIENT_OPTS="$HADOOP_CLIENT_OPTS -Xlog:gc:/data01/data/apache-hive-metastore-4.1.0-bin/log/hivemetastore-gc-%t.log -XX:HeapDumpPath=/data01/data/apache-hive-metastore-4.1.0-bin/log/hms_heapdump.hprof -Dmetastore.log.dir=/data01/data/apache-hive-metastore-4.1.0-bin/log -Dhive.log.file=hivemetastore.log"
  • put mysql-jdbc.jar into HMS lib directory
  • create metastore-site.xml with the following content:
  <configuration>
  <property>
    <name>javax.jdo.option.ConnectionPassword</name>
    <value>pwssd</value>
  </property>
  <property>
    <name>javax.jdo.option.ConnectionURL</name>
    <value>jdbc:mysql://127.0.01:3306/hive?createDatabaseIfNotExist=true</value>
  </property>
  <property>
    <name>javax.jdo.option.ConnectionDriverName</name>
    <value>com.mysql.jdbc.Driver</value>
    <description>Driver class name for a JDBC metastore</description>
  </property>
  <property>
    <name>javax.jdo.option.ConnectionUserName</name>
    <value>hive</value>
  </property>
</configuration>
  • start standalone HMS
/data01/data/apache-hive-metastore-4.1.0-bin/bin/start-metastore

And then check the metastore.log from directory /data01/data/apache-hive-metastore-4.1.0-bin/log
There might be a fatal exception(cannot connect to MySQL I guess), can you turn on the debug log please?
pmf = retry(() -> initPMF(conf, false));

dengzh Please check the standalone hms debug log file.

I can confirm that the connection to MySQL is ok, and this error does not cause the HMS to fail to start.

Additionally, this error does not occur every time during startup, but it appears relatively frequently when starting up.

Do you have the hive-site.xml as well in the classpath? in this file the javax.jdo.option.ConnectionURL is configured to the derby:

2025-07-09T16:33:18,670 DEBUG [Metastore threads starter thread] metastore.PersistenceManagerProvider: Found javax.jdo.option.ConnectionURL to be different. Old val : jdbc:mysql://127.0.0.1:3306/hive?createDatabaseIfNotExist=true : New Val : jdbc:derby:;databaseName=metastore_db;create=true

Only metastore-site.xml was put into conf/ directory, no hive-site.xml.

ll apache-hive-metastore-4.1.0-bin/conf/
total 128K
-rw-r--r-- 1 hive hive 2.7K Jul  9 16:28 metastore-log4j2.properties
-rwxr-xr-x 1 hive hive 3.9K Jul  9 15:43 metastore-site.xml
-rw-r--r-- 1 hive hive 119K Jan  1  2025 metastore-site.xml.template
Despite this error, the metadata can still be correctly obtained, and some basic tasks can be executed normally.

I guess somehow we miss that, because the hive.metastore.uris is found in the debug log:

2025-07-09T16:33:18,658 DEBUG [Metastore threads starter thread] conf.HiveConf: Found metastore URI of thrift://127.0.0.1:9083

or could we export HIVE_CONF_DIR=./apache-hive-metastore-4.1.0-bin/conf/ specifically?

Apologies, there were indeed a few extra propeties(such as hive.metastore.urisl) in my local metastore-site.xml, but I believe they didn't affect the test results.

However, to avoid any misunderstanding, I reran the tests with the cleaner metastore-site.xml, and the exception still occurred. BTW, i also did export HIVE_CONF_DIR=./apache-hive-metastore-4.1.0-bin/conf/ before starting hms.

  • metastore-site.xml 
      <configuration>
  <property>
    <name>javax.jdo.option.ConnectionPassword</name>
    <value>pwssd</value>
  </property>
  <property>
    <name>javax.jdo.option.ConnectionURL</name>
    <value>jdbc:mysql://127.0.0.1:3306/hive?createDatabaseIfNotExist=true</value>
  </property>
  <property>
    <name>javax.jdo.option.ConnectionDriverName</name>
    <value>com.mysql.jdbc.Driver</value>
  </property>
  <property>
    <name>javax.jdo.option.ConnectionUserName</name>
    <value>root</value>
  </property>
 </configuration>

See the standalone hms debug log metastore_new.log

Thanks.
I filed a PR to fix the issue, a workaround is renaming the metastore-site.xml to hive-site.xml

a workaround is renaming the metastore-site.xml to hive-site.xml

I just did the test, renaming metastore-site to hivemetastore-site.xml could aslo be a workaround.
If metastore-site.xml doesn't have any special functions, is hivemetastore-site.xml already sufficient?
i've added the hive-4.1.0-must label for tracking. Please remove if we do not need it in 4.1

Merged to master. 

Thanks dengzh  and zhangbutao ! Cherry-pick to branch 4-1 is pending.

Merged into master branch & branch-4.1.

Thanks dengzhdkuzmenko
